solution: The large circle has radius 3, so its area is $\pi \cdot 3^2= 9\pi$. The seven small circles have a total area of $7\left(\pi\cdot 1^2\right)= 7\pi$. So the shaded region has area $9\pi - 7\pi = \boxed{2\pi}$.
model_solution:
The area of the shaded region consists of 6 identical sections, each 60° sector of the large circle, minus a section of one of the smaller circles.

Let $r$ be the radius of the large circle. Then the area of each section of the shaded region is $\frac{1}{6}\cdot \pi r^2 - \pi$.
steps:
The area of the shaded region consists of 6 identical sections, each 60° sector of the large circle, minus a section of one of the smaller circles.

Let $r$ be the radius of the large circle. Then the area of each section of the shaded region is $\frac{1}{6}\cdot \pi r^2 - \pi$.
full_steps:
The area of the shaded region consists of 6 identical sections, each 60° sector of the large circle, minus a section of one of the smaller circles.

Let $r$ be the radius of the large circle. Then the area of each section of the shaded region is $\frac{1}{6}\cdot \pi r^2 - \pi$.
